query.result: 13 We were walking with the ten demons. 14 Oh fierce company! but in church 15 with the saints, and in the tavern with gluttons.

query.result: 16 My attention was still on the pitch, 17 to see every aspect of the ditch 18 and of the people who were burning inside it.

19 Come i dalfini, quando fanno segno 20 a’ marinar con l’arco de la schiena 21 che s’argomentin di campar lor legno,
22 talor così, ad alleggiar la pena, 23 mostrav’ alcun de’ peccatori ’l dosso 24 e nascondea in men che non balena.
query.result:
19 Like dolphins, when they signal 20 to sailors with the arch of their backs 21 that they should try to save their ship,
22 sometimes like that, to alleviate the pain, 23 one of the sinners would show his back 24 and hide it again in less than a flash of lightning.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
25 E come a l’orlo de l’acqua d’un fosso 26 stanno i ranocchi pur col muso fuori, 27 sì che celano i piedi e l’altro grosso,
28 sì stavan d’ogne parte i peccatori; 29 ma come s’appressava Barbariccia, 30 così si ritraén sotto i bollori.
query.result:
25 And like frogs at the water's edge of a ditch 26 stand with only their snouts outside, 27 so that they hide their feet and the rest of their bodies,
28 so stood the sinners on every side; 29 but as Barbariccia approached, 30 they would all retreat under the boiling pitch.

31 I saw, and my heart still shudders at it, 32 one of them waiting like this, as he sees 33 that one frog stays and the other escapes;
34 and Graffiacane, who was closest to him, 35 hooked his claws into his tarred hair 36 and pulled him up, and he looked to me like an otter.

query.prompt:
Please translate literally into English.
37 I’ sapea già di tutti quanti ’l nome, 38 sì li notai quando fuorono eletti, 39 e poi ch’e’ si chiamaro, attesi come.
query.result: 37 I already knew the names of all of them, 38 because I had noted them down when they were chosen, 39 and then when they called to each other, I paid attention to how.

query.result: 40 "Oh Rubicante, make sure you put 41 your claws on his back, so that you flay him!", 42 all the damned shouted together.

query.result: 43 And I said: "My master, do, if you can, 44 so that you may know who is the wretch 45 who has fallen into the hands of his adversaries."
